title: How do video conferencing businesses make money? - Quora

response.answer_text: If you are referring to Freemium platforms that don’t charge for versions with limited functionality, they are counting on you to upgrade to paid versions. We are Pro users of JoinMe, who started out as free users, now likely to move to Premium users. If the application is good and useful, you find more ways to employ it. That has proven true for us. Although I’ve created multiple video conferencing apps, they have never been free. They’ve been custom designed for a specific client and usually a very specific type of video meeting, such as meetings of new drug researchers discussing clinical protocols. As for Google Hangouts, the Google monetization model depends on determining the interests of each user and then selling that interest profile to the highest bidder. If you are going to a Hangout where the optimization of alpaca wool is the topic, it’s safe to assume that they’ll sell that intelligence to wool harvesting vendors.

It saves a ton of money on travel and expenses. The company either hires someone to handle the conferencing or does it themselves. This amount of savings can be tremendous as services only charge a fraction of what it would cost to physically travel.
